thread.title: Fall Antiques Market to benefit historical society
thread.title_full: Fall Antiques Market to benefit historical society

title: Fall Antiques Market to benefit historical society
text:
Close Image 1 of 1 The Wilton Fall Antiques Market takes place Sunday, Oct. 25, from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. at the Wilton High School Field House on Route 7, to benefit the Wilton Historical Society. The Wilton Fall Antiques Market takes place Sunday, Oct. 25, from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. at the Wilton High School Field House on Route 7, to benefit the Wilton Historical Society. Photo: Contributed Photo Fall Antiques Market to benefit historical society 1 / 1 Back to Gallery 
The Wilton Fall Antiques Market — to benefit the Wilton Historical Society — will take place on Sunday, Oct. 25, at the Wilton High School Field House. 
Presented by Barn Star Productions, the show will feature about 40 artisans who specialize in Americana, fine and folk art, samplers, jewelry, early lighting, hooked and Oriental rugs, cast iron garden furnishings, fireplace equipment, ceramics, nautical objects, textiles, sterling silver, trade signs and weather vanes in room setting displays. 
“This has always been a show that introduces new trends to the market,” say organizers, adding that Federal-period furniture and folk art will lead the way. Dealers from Vermont, Massachusetts, Connecticut, upstate New York and Pennsylvania “keep the show interesting and fresh by adding regional eccentricities to the mix,” they add. 
Also featured will be complimentary vintage newspapers, style and decorating magazines. Food and beverages will be available for purchase on site. 
Wilton High School Field House, 395 Danbury Road (Route 7). Sunday, Oct. 25, 9 a.m.-5 p.m. $10. Free parking. Handicapped accessible. 845-876-0616, barnstar.com or wiltonhistorical.org
